The patient is a 71-year-old female with a medical history of bilateral lower extremity paralysis, epidural hematoma, cord compression, deep vein thrombosis (DVT) with inferior vena cava (IVC) filter placement, diabetes mellitus type 2, atrial fibrillation (Afib), and large left-sided pleural effusion. She also has hypercarbic respiratory failure.

Assessment and plan:
1. Hypercarbic respiratory failure: most likely due to the combination of a large left-sided pleural effusion and associated atelectasis. No evidence of obstructive airways disease on exam to explain her hypercarbia.
- Introduce pigtail drain at bedside today to relieve pleural effusion and hopefully allow for re-expansion of L lung.
- Start lasix gtt for improved diuresis.
- Continue with rate control using metoprolol.
- Continue to support nutritional status.
- Send pleural fluid for analysis.

2. Afib with RVR - she was started on metoprolol postoperatively for Afib with RVR. Currently well rate-controlled.
- Continue metoprolol.

3. h/o DVT, s/p IVC filter placement: Patient has a history of L popliteal DVT, during her last admission she had negative LENIs, however due to concern about restarting coumadin in the setting of epidural bleed an IVC filter was placed by IR. Prior to her discharge to rehab she was restarted on coumadin and had an INR of 2.3 on admission.
- Will transition to heparin gtt following thoracentesis today.
- Restart coumadin tomorrow if doing well post [**Female First Name (un) 217**].

4. Anasarca - likely [**1-29**] diastolic CHF c/b Afib w/rvr as well as poor nutritional status.
- Start lasix gtt if stable following procedure with goal diuresis -1-2L.
- F/u [**Hospital1 7**] lytes and replete prn.
- Monitor bicarb, may need to hold off on diuresis if appears to be intravascularly depleted (does have slight creatinine/HCO3 bump today).
- Continue to support nutrition.

5. Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: Stable
- Continue glargine and insulin sliding scale.

6. C. difficile - diagnosed during her recent admission, started on flagyl, no apparent complications.
- Continue flagyl to be completed on [**2101-11-15**] (7 days after ampicillin stopped).

7. Skin breakdown - she has multiple areas of skin breakdown likely due to poor nutritional status and anasarca as well as new paralysis.
- Continue to support nutritional status, appreciate nutrition reccs.
- F/u wound care reccs.

8. Hyperlipidemia: Stable
- Continue fenofibrate and pravastatin.

9. FEN: diabetic diet; replete lytes prn.
- Continue multivitamin.
